alert.note: Alert for Central Laramie County; East Platte County; South Laramie Range Foothills (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: High Wind Warning issued December 12 at 2:31AM MST until December 12 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM MST EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...West winds 35 to 45 MPH with gusts up to 60 MPH. * WHERE...East Platte and central Laramie counties including the cities of Wheatland and Cheyenne. * WHEN...Until 5 AM MST this morning. * IMPACTS...Mainly to transportation. Strong cross winds will be hazardous to light weight and high profile vehicles, including campers and tractor trailers. There will be a high risk for vehicle blow overs, particularly along north to south oriented roadways. In addition, areas of blowing snow will also reduce visibility to less than one mile at times.
info.instruction: A High Wind Warning means a hazardous high wind event is expected or occurring. Sustained wind speeds of at least 40 mph or gusts of 58 mph or more can lead to property damage.

area.areaDesc: Central Laramie County; East Platte County; South Laramie Range Foothills
